welcomeMessage: Welcome **@Hullow**, I'm your Copilot and I'm here to help you get things done faster.

I'm powered by AI, so surprises and mistakes are possible. Make sure to verify any generated code or suggestions, and [share feedback](https://aka.ms/microsoft/vscode-copilot-release) so that we can learn and improve. Check out the [Copilot documentation](https://docs.github.com/copilot/getting-started-with-github-copilot?tool=vscode) to learn more.

parts.text: What are .vscdb files and how to read them _

message.text: What are .vscdb files and how to read them _

response.value:
.vscdb files are not a standard file format and are not directly related to software development. They might be specific to a certain application or system. If they are related to Visual Studio Code, it's not a publicly documented feature. 

To read or interpret any file, you need to know the format or have a program that can interpret it. If it's a binary file, you might need a hex editor or a specific reader for that file type. If it's a text-based file, you can try opening it with a text editor.

If you have more context about where these .vscdb files are coming from or what they are used for, I might be able to provide a more specific answer.

followups.message: How can I open a binary file in a hex editor?
followups.title: How can I open a binary file in a hex editor?
